title: Pollution from Power Plant Waterways Diagram

content.description: The diagram shows a power plant designed to generate electricity for a nearby city.
content.question: The water used in this type of power plant is often released back into a reservoir. Which of the following effects could this released water have on the reservoir?

choices.label: The released water is radioactive and is lethal to a variety of organisms in the reservoir.
Chemical pollutants in the released water cause algal blooms in the reservoir.
Ash from the power plant is dissolved in the released water and will precipitate out into the reservoir.
The temperature of the released water causes a decrease in the amount of dissolved oxygen in the reservoir.

content.answer: The temperature of the released water causes a decrease in the amount of dissolved oxygen in the reservoir.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain how environmental concepts and processes represented visually relate to broader environmental issues.
